1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Eliphaz, the name of one of Job's friends, and of a son of Esau
a Temanite or descendant of Teman

2.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to be familiar with; by implication, to minister to, be serviceable to, be customary
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be familiar with; by implication, to minister to, be serviceable to, be customary
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent

3.brief: pleasure; hence (abstractly) desire; concretely, a valuable thing; hence (by extension) a matter (as something in mind)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to complete, in a good or a bad sense, literal, or figurative, transitive or intransitive
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

4.brief: fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

5.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
an extremity; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) after

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition)
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
gratis, i.e. devoid of cost, reason or advantage
a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
to spread out (i.e. deploy in hostile array); by analogy, to strip (i.e. unclothe, plunder, flay, etc.)

7.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to quaff, i.e. (causatively) to irrigate or furnish apotion to
to debar (negatively or positively) from benefit or injury
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)

8.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

9.brief: a widow; also a desolate place
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
to crumble; transitively, to bruise (literally or figuratively)

10.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
a (metallic) sheet (as pounded thin); also a spring net (as spread out like a lamina)
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously
a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)

11.brief: desire (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) or, also if
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)

12.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a star (as round or as shining); figuratively, a prince
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)

13.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)

14.brief: properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse
a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)

15.brief: a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

16.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
properly, to pour out (transitive or intransitive); by implication, to melt or cast as metal; by extension, to place firmly, to stiffen or grow hard

17.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise

18.brief: he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

19.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
to deride; by implication (as if imitating a foreigner) to speak unintelligibly

20.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to secrete, by act or word; hence (intensively) to destroy
an opponent (as rising against one), i.e. (collectively) enemies
properly, an overhanging, i.e. (by implication) an excess, superiority, remainder; also a small rope (as hanging free)

21.brief: to be familiar with; by implication, to minister to, be serviceable to, be customary
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

22.brief: to take (in the widest variety of applications)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
the heart (as the most interior organ);

23.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)

24.brief: to place (in a very wide application)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
strictly a clipping, i.e. gold (as dug out)
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
Ophir, the name of a son of Joktan, and of a gold region in the East

25.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
strictly a clipping, i.e. gold (as dug out)
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
(only in plural collective) weariness, i.e. (by implication) toil (treasure so obtained) or speed

at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to be soft or pliable, i.e. (figuratively) effeminate or luxurious
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
near, with or among; often in general, to
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

27.brief: to burn incense in worship, i.e. intercede (reciprocally, listen to prayer)
near, with or among; often in general, to
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a promise (to God); also (concretely) a thing promised
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)

28.brief: to cut down or off; (figuratively) to destroy, divide, exclude, or decide
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

29.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to depress or sink (expectation figuratively, to humiliate, intransitive or transitive)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

30.brief: properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
